name: Soho Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after our wedding in Las Vegas in October 2012. From the moment we arrived at the hotel I fell in love with it. We were greeted by very handsome staff from our taxi and the fact all the staff looked so stylish and were so friendly made the place even better! Upon check in we were given a complimentary glass of sparkling wine which was a lovely touch and added to my excitement.
reviews.title: Fabulous location for stay in Soho area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Corner room, which was cosy but had everything you needed. The bed was very comfortable and the view from the room was brilliant as we could see everything going on in the street below.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and people

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the hotel as we were out and about during most of our stay, but we did have a drink in the hotel bar one evening which was enjoyable. The main lobby area and reception are very cool and dimly light which give this hotel it's funky, cool and trendy feeling.
reviews.title: Work it!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was perfect for us as we wanted to explore the Soho area during our second trip to NYC. It was close to a number of good resturants and only 5 minutes away from all the shops we wanted to go to in the Soho / Broadway area.
reviews.title: Dogs welcome

reviews.text: If we we're to go to NYC again (which I'm sure we will), I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Nice try...but really

reviews.text: Great location, trendy hotel and room was nice, however we found the staff in the lounge pompous and the concierge ladies were useless. We asked for an Italian restaurant upon our arrival - we were recommended to the closest restaurant. The following morning we waited for the concierge’s help, while she called a friend and ask her to call her back because she thought our phone was broken...this could have been done once we left as there was no lineup. Best part was, the help was not very helpful. Overall the hotel is nice, but help was hard to be found. Location is wonderful - shopping right out the door, Little Italy a ten minute walk away and the subway was one minute from the hotel.
reviews.title: Pretentious Staff & Trendy Hotel
Sloppy
reviews.text: Check in took forever: first the key cards didn't work. Once we got into the room, it was not as described. (We'd paid for a room with views in two directions). We asked for a different room, and were given new key cards, only one of which worked. We got into the room, stepping over a tray of dirty dishes in the doorway, and found dirty linens left behind. Yuck.
Management was barely apologetic.
reviews.title: seen better days
Disappointing
reviews.text: This used to be a very sexy hotel. Now it's just sloppy.

I've stayed at the hotel 3 times over the past 2 years, and it's gotten pretty shabby--both in service and amenities. During this visit--the tub drain wouldn't close, then wouldn't drain, the hair dryer didn't work, the PHONE wouldn't work, and the internet--for which they charge--was spotty--either slow or not functioning. The rooms clearly need some maintenance. The worst part of all of that, is that the staff clearly don't care. I agree with an earlier view that staff are mostly concerned with saving a buck. I don't think this is an isolated case either, as while I was dealing with the issues at the desk, the customer next to me came to the desk and said, you know, there was a problem with everything! Multiple visits from service men didn't fix the room's problems!
reviews.title: Overall great stay

likes.liked: — location and friendly door and housekeeping staff

reviews.text: Just spent a few nights here and had a great time. Cool bar area with a smattering of the beautiful people and some de rigeur minor celebrities with drinks that certainly don't skimp on their alcohol content! Good food and a fun ambience including small but well arranged rooms. My only issue isn't the hotel's fault - it is just massively noisy which if you aren't used to it makes it a little tough to sleep. That said, it is a small price to pay for a great location and fun atmosphere.
reviews.title: Fun but noisy

reviews.text: A really nice atmosphere for a hotel - the staff were efficient and pleasant, which was especially good on our first day after a stressful trip in a New York taxi. The rooms were small, as you would expect in a city of that size, but not unreasonable. The breakfasts were well made and well served. The prices for the stay were expensive but not extortionate, and they were very accommodating when we asked for an extra night as opposed to what we'd booked, not raising the price. My one complain would be the air conditioning in the rooms - It seemed to turn on very noisy and blast until the room was very cold, then turn off again until it was uncomfortably hot. However, overall we had a really good stay and took away lots of positive memories. Would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Trendy and welcoming

reviews.text: The hotel feels like a casual second-home of old-school money types. So it is not casual exactly, but sort of a studied informality tinged with a touch of snootiness. So that can be good or bad, depending on what you're looking for.
reviews.title: Nice decor, trendy attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good -- fast and reasonably priced room service breakfasts (by Soho standards -- $30 incl tip will get you eggs, meat, potatoes, veggies, pancake, coffee, and juice).
reviews.title: overpriced and noisy

reviews.text: My room was surprisingly large, with generous floor space between the dresser and the bed, and also a small table to the side with one chair, but someone mentioned that in their room, the table was almost touching the bed so apparently I got lucky (room 1022). The lone chair was very uncomfortable though, so if you plan on spending any time in the room expect to do it on the bed.
reviews.title: Not quite as good this time:(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Soho Grand in May. The location is superbe if you like the to hang out in Soho. Very good restaurants and boutiques are close by.
reviews.title: Fancy but overprized
Noisy, not a wnderful experience
reviews.text: It's for sure a special spot with tasteful details and furniture but if you're really into design, you'll be disappointed. They try too hard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly, although it took them 15 minutes to serve my cappucino.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The room was very small and quiet disappointing. So is the bathroom. There is no space for storaging all products and amenities were very poor.
reviews.title: Soho not so grand!

likes.liked: — Bose music system in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall it's a nice hotel but totally overprized. If you pay over $ 500 for a room, you expect it to be perfect. Would not go back!
reviews.title: Fantastix

reviews.text: It's a destination hotel for tourists and locals who flock to the bar and lounge area. Free wifi and very friendly staff that brought us slippers, extra sheets and even late checkout until 2pm. If you pay for the city view you get the Empire State Building, without you get the new Liberty Tower.
reviews.title: Über Chic in Soho

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 night on business in the deluxe king room. The hotel is older but I found it clean and comfortable. Very good bed, and a full bath was part of my room (most hotels in Manhattan in my experience have showers only so the extra space is a bonus). Free internet throughout. There is an onsite gym with 2 treadmills, an ellipse, a bike, and free weights.
reviews.title: An older hotel being presented as 'boutique'; comfortable but pricey

reviews.text: The air con/heat fan can be turned auto or left on. I left it in the ON position as it provided good background noise to drown out the street below (although it was a bit loud you get used to the 'white noise' pretty quick).
reviews.title: Great location.... great hotel
Artistic Retro
reviews.text: Rooms are average size for New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Common areas are trendy, warehousey and nice for sure.
reviews.title: great location
Classy
reviews.text: Rooms are trendy, but like most New York hotels, are pretty small. What stands out is the bar area, which I type this from. We've been here for the last five hours; cocktails, people-watching and some great music have kept us here. I'm pretty sure we had other plans, but never mind!

Be prepared to have loose dogs all over the place - running, barking, totally out of control. AND, although illegal in NYC, this place allows dogs to be in their restaurant. That means while you are eating, dogs will be running between your legs, jumping on the couch next to you, barking, begging for food and of course the owners (for the most part) think this is cute.
reviews.title: Terrible experience unless you absolutely love dogs

reviews.text: There is no effort to stop a dog from barking all night. I told the front desk that the dog in the next room barked incessantly and nothing was done after 7 complaints.
reviews.title: New York's spirit

reviews.text: The furniture is early Goodwill so be prepared to stay at a DUMP.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel

reviews.text: On the other hand, the staff (except for not responidng to my complaint which is probably owner-driven) is marvelous.
reviews.title: Great service, Location - Tiny rooms -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited NYC for 9 days back in 2006 and chose to stay at the Soho Grand due to the location and the boutique style of the hotel. Then entrance foyer was very impressive and the industrial theme of the architecture appealed.
reviews.title: Location, Location

likes.liked: — Location to a great area of New York

reviews.title: TINY room, cute wallpaper
reviews.text: The concierge service was very good and willing to help with bookings and information. We checked into a room on a lower level and were offered an upgrade to a higher level providing us better views of the surrounding area (Parking lot).

reviews.title: Beatiful Place
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and comfortable. They weren't huge on space but I did not expect a grand living area for a hotel in downtown New York. The hotel was two blocks from many bars, shops and restaurants in the Tribeca / Soho area where we went most evenings avoiding the bling of Times Square. there was a subway station behind the hotel for access uptown and to Brooklyn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest let down with the hotel was the pompous staff working in the bar area of the hotel. As we returned from a shopping spree, we sat at a table and although requested drinks, watched as the waitress rushed to the suits. After one drink, we decided to go. Upon billing the drinks to our room, the attitude changed and the girl was only to happy to help. Needless to say there was no tip for this pathetic act.
reviews.title: Not so great, BAD MANAGEMENT!!!!!

reviews.text: We tended to eat & drink out, enjoying the friendly service of other establishments who were more than happy to assist.
reviews.title: SO .. SO Grand hotel

reviews.text: After reading the review from "Soho Not So Grand" I thought the guy that wrote it must have stayed with us. We had much the same expereince. The hotel overall is not guest friendly, is statring to look dated, the rooms are very small and the attitude - even for a so-called "hip property" is unaccepable, through the roof.
reviews.title: Soho Not So Grand Deja Vu

reviews.text: In my opinion, hip is great if it can be backed up with across-the-board service and quality accomodations. The Soho Grand may have been all that a few years ago, but now it's just all flat.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

likes.disliked: — Poor service, small room, poor TV channel selection

reviews.title: Great location, service can be a bit up and down...
reviews.text: Just a few of our disapointments with the hotel on our recent stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked our room, I specifically told the reservationist that we were bringing our daughter down to the hotel to see the July 4th fireworks. Naturally my first concern was that we'd have a high floor room with a view toward the fireworks. No problem, assured the reservationist. There was a problem. Upon checking into the hotel they only had a higher floor room on the opposite corner of the hotel facing away from the fireworks. Note: After scoping out the surrounding buildings I determined it was highly unlikely any room would have given a view of the Macy's fireworks. By the way, when we checked in and explained this to the front desk clerk he told us we'd be able to see them since they were shot off from around Macys! I didn't have the time or energy at this point to explain that the fireworks are shot off from the East River. This was the second desk clerk to help us, and at least he made an effort. The first one didn't know anything about anything, but she made sure to give free champagne to three people who walked up to the desk while we wre attemptiong to check-in. I eventually asked a third desk clerk if we too, paying customers, might actually be granted the bounty of their kindness with a glass. She instructed clueless clerk # 1 to pour us some. So anyway, that first clerk upon being told of the fireworks-view room didn't even seem to realize it was the Fourth of July. Then she said, rather disinterestedly, that she had no idea if the room had any view. I inquired further if I might have a look at the room, and she said they couldn't allow that since housekeeping was still cleaning. Okay. Then she tells me I should tallk to the concierge. Now, I go from attitude to super attitude. She hands me the phone and the concierge is on the other end. I explain that the front desk connected me to her (though I'm not sure why) and that we were told our room would have view of the fireworks. The concierge is obviosuly mad that the front desk would lay this on her, and I have to somewhat agree (the front desk should know their own rooms), but it didn't call for Super Attitude. Her cocky reponse was "Are you kidding?" No I wasn't. I should have cut my losses right there and gone to another hotel, but I had my wife and baby and we were all getting tired. An hour later we checked in to our closet and had a nice view on the wrong side of the hotel. The service throughout the stay was cold, or at the least aloof. And it's not aNew York thing, I lived there for years and have stayed in numerous hotels across the city. This place is just run bad and the physical look of the hotels just shows that they don't care anymore. as oftentimes happens when a new hotel opens (the Tribeca Grand) the better staff make abeline to the newer property. I don't know if that's what's happened here, but I threw away $500 for arotten stay. We ended up trudging downtown in the rain and saw about fifteen minutes of the fireworks.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One major exception: Did these guys even work for the same hotel? The guys (part of the bell staff) out front and the man who delivered our bags to the room were top-notch, friendly and professional. Now if we could just take them to a better hotel!
reviews.title: Terriffic place to stay!!!

description: New York City’s celebrated luxury lifestyle hotel located in the heart of downtown, Soho Grand features impeccably decorated guest rooms, chic bar and lounge and is steps from NYC’s best attractions.
